image.altText: A man with long hair in a polo shirt stands in front of a pyramid shaped building and flag poles.

props.synopsis: Former Barkly mayor Jeff McLaughlin has avoided a conviction for drug-driving and cannabis possession after prosecutors withdrew more serious charges against him.

title.children: Jeff McLaughlin avoids conviction, cleared of serious drug charges

image.altText: Four men standing in front of a red helicopter. Jason Faddoul has a black goatee, blue shirt and wide brim hat on.

props.synopsis: When Harold Lasseter died alone in the desert in 1931, he took secrets of a supposed vast gold-bearing reef with him. His tale inspired generations of expeditions, which continue to this day.

title.children: Search continues for Lasseter's elusive gold reef, almost a century on

image.altText: A group of police officers walk down a street in front of a shop front at night

props.synopsis: South Australian police officers will be deployed to Alice Springs, following calls for assistance from the Northern Territory police commissioner.

title.children: SA police officers deployed to Alice Springs amid ongoing crime

image.altText: Barbed wire

props.synopsis: Ballooning numbers of arrests are putting immense pressure on the NT’s police station cells, with the police association president saying he fears it's a "matter of time" until a death in custody.

title.children: NT police station cells at capacity with prisoners, as arrests rise

image.altText: Drone shot of tropical beach

props.synopsis: The upcoming departure of Rio Tinto has raised concerns about the economic future of communities on the Gove Peninsula. But there are hopes yacht and cruise tourism could be the answer.

title.children: Remote Arnhem Land turns to tourism on cusp of Rio Tinto's departure

image.altText: Two US warships in a training exercise in the Pacific Ocean.

props.synopsis: A report on an emergency exercise released under Freedom of Information reveals how Australia's dependency on imported fuel could leave it vulnerable to geopolitical tensions.

title.children: Home fuel security falls short as 'war-game' report reveals weaknesses

image.altText: An older man with dyed blond hair and a bronzed face grits his teeth behind a microphone.

props.synopsis: A New York court denies president-elect Donald Trump's latest bid to delay this week's sentencing in his hush money case.

title.children: New York court rejects latest Trump bid to halt hush money sentencing

image.altText: CFA firefighting equipment hangs from hooks.

props.synopsis: Fire authorities say an out-of-control bushfire is burning at Cape Otway. Campers have been evacuated from the area.

title.children: Campers evacuated as bushfire takes hold at Cape Otway

image.altText: A man in business clothing stands in an office space, talking on the phone.

props.synopsis: A $5.3 billion fund — billed as the nation's largest-ever investment by a state government in social housing — was rolled out in Victoria four years ago. Now questions are being asked about where the money's being spent.

title.children: Victoria tipped billions into social housing, but the waitlist has grown

image.altText: A man wearing high vis, a safety helmet and blue overalls looks up at a stack of large shipping containers.

props.synopsis: The cold chain process is a little understood part of our food supply chain. It changed how and what we eat today.

title.children: Creating ice stumped many, until an Australian discovered a commercial fix

image.altText: A swarm of black fish part to making way for a grey shark swimming through.

props.synopsis: Shark attacks have steadily risen over time as more people enter the water, but one shark researcher says the likelihood of being bitten is still "exceptionally low".

title.children: Not all shark attacks are random and you can take steps to reduce risk

image.altText: A destroyed house surrounding by building debris

props.synopsis: Chinese state media said the quake struck China's Dingri county at the foot of Mount Everest and was felt as far away as neighbouring Nepal and parts of India.

title.children: At least 126 killed as magnitude-6.8 earthquake hits China's Tibet region

image.altText: Jean-Marie Le Pen sitting at a press conference, with a Le Pen logo behind him in the colours of the French flag.

props.synopsis: Le Pen founded the populist and Eurosceptic political party National Front, which is now led by his daughter and is the largest party in France's parliament.

title.children: Prominent far-right French politician Jean-Marie Le Pen dies

image.altText: A young woman drinking a shake in a park before going for a run.

props.synopsis: If you've vowed to hit the gym in 2025, you may encounter "pre-workouts": powders promising bulked-up muscles and increased endurance. We look at the evidence behind their claims.

title.children: Do 'pre-workout' powders help you get stronger faster?

image.altText: A shot of still ocean water and a white sandy beach lined with palm trees.

props.synopsis: Health professionals fear vaccine conspiracies and COVID-19 disruptions could be partly responsible for a spike in measles cases in countries including Vietnam and Thailand.

title.children: Measles outbreaks in South-East Asia bringing cases to Australia

image.altText: two men standing on a boat, looking out to the side, there is a fishing rope in view

props.synopsis: Jelly blubber are overwhelming the Hawkesbury River and some say harvesting them for sale as a delicacy may be the solution.

title.children: Jellyfish 'boom' swamping river forces fishermen to get second jobs

image.altText: City office-workers and passers-by watch the ASX board in Sydney

props.synopsis: A fall on Wall Street is likely to send Australian stocks lower, while Bureau of Statistics monthly inflation data is expected to show core inflation remains above the Reserve Bank's 2-3 per cent target band. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: ASX to fall ahead of monthly inflation, Wall Street sinks

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australian home price falls ahead: Corelogic
What to expect for today's monthly CPI at 11:30am AEDT
Wall Street drops amid concerns of inflation rebound

image.altText: A woman in a pink jumper holds a bunch of toilet paper rolls

props.synopsis: Do you know how many toilet rolls we each use a year? Or why some paper has patterns on it? Test your knowledge and find out in our quiz.

title.children: How much do you know about what we flush?

image.altText: A drone looking down shows a missile about to blast closely past it.

props.synopsis:
North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has overseen a successful test of a new intermediate-range hypersonic ballistic missile, state media KCNA said.
It was North Korea's first missile launch since November 5, and coincided with a visit to South Korea by US Secretary of State, Antony Blinken.

title.children: North Korea releases video of missile launch

image.altText: Ken Randall chairing a discussion at the National Press Club

props.synopsis: The highly respected journalist was also, at 22 years, the longest-serving president of the National Press Club (NPC) in Canberra, where he was patron from 2016 until his death on Monday evening.

title.children: Veteran political journalist and ABC host Ken Randall dies aged 88

image.altText: protestors hold south korean flags supporting president yoon

props.synopsis: The Corruption Investigation Office for High-Ranking Officials has not confirmed how long the warrant would remain valid.

title.children: South Korean court re-issues arrest warrant for impeached President Yoon

image.altText: A close up of an open cotton flower

props.synopsis: After years planting cotton, a growing region has built up a soil pest that sucks the life out of crops — but there may be a solution on the horizon.

title.children: Microscopic soil pest wreaking havoc on cotton crops in Queensland

image.altText: Hadi Nazari was reported missing in the Kosciuszko National Park on Boxing Day

props.synopsis: Police say camera gear and a lighter thought to belong to missing hiker Hadi Nazari have been found at a campfire site in the Kosciuszko National Park.

title.children: Fresh clues found as search continues for hiker missing in Snowy Mountains

image.altText: An older man kneels on the brick-lined kerb of a suburban road.

props.synopsis: Four men including the landowner laid down Lapstone's red brick kerbs and they haven't changed in 70 years.

title.children: The two distinctive things that make these Blue Mountains streets stand out

image.altText: A woman uses a selfie stick to take a photo of her and Big Ben

props.synopsis: Planning to head to the UK in 2025? Here's what you need to know about a new digital travel permit.

title.children: Travellers will soon have to pay to enter the UK. What you need to know

image.altText: a row of voting ballot boxes

props.synopsis: Thousands of Tasmanians are off the hook for fines imposed for not voting in council elections, due to an administrative error.

title.children: 4,000 off the hook after failure-to-vote fines scrapped over error

image.altText: A close-up of a person's feet as they rest on a beach.

props.synopsis: No-one likes talking about toe fungus, but podiatrists say you shouldn't be embarrassed about the infection, as it's more common than you may think.

title.children: Foot fungus can be embarrassing but doctors say early treatment is key

image.altText: A man with brown hair and a moustache wearing a neck brace gives a thumbs up from a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: Professional cyclist Jay Vine aims to claim his second Tour Down Under title after recovering from a life-threatening crash.

title.children: Jay Vine sets sights on second title after life-threatening crash

image.altText: William Yang Milestone

props.synopsis: William Yang, one of Australia's leading artists, celebrates his eight-decade life in a new show premiering at Sydney Festival.

title.children: Meet the 81-year-old who photographed the birth of Sydney's gay culture

image.altText: Jacob Vennix and Kimberley Fuller smile on their wedding day

props.synopsis: The heartbroken wife of Jacob Vennix, who drowned during their Bali honeymoon, says she will use the money to return him home and to donate a defibrillator to the hospital he was taken to after he was pulled from the ocean.

title.children: Wife of Bali drowning victim will use fundraiser to bring husband home

image.altText: A burning remains of a plane.

props.synopsis: Park Sang-woo said "I feel heavy responsibility for this disaster," and that he will try to find the right time to resign from his post.

title.children: South Korean minister plans to resign over country's worst plane crash

image.altText: White foam is sprayed from a yellow fire truck towards a plane that is parked on the tarmac.

props.synopsis: The Australian Transport Safety Bureau says an engine gauge on the Etihad Airways passenger plane was showing a high exhaust gas temperature.

title.children: Authorities reveal cause of Etihad Airways aborted take-off in Melbourne

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: Queensland Premier David Crisafulli opens up on his plans to use the federal election to his advantage.

title.children: Crisafulli calls for politicians to can 'childish' talk on Australia's energy future

image.altText: Firefighters work to cibtain blaze near a country town.

props.synopsis: An abrupt wind change leaves a volunteer firefighter with burns while battling a bushfire near Capel, south of Bunbury.

title.children: Firefighters survive burnover while battling bushfire in southern WA

image.altText: Three men laying turf at a race track.

props.synopsis: Police are testing discarded weed spray nozzles found at the Gold Coast Turf Club as the mystery deepens into how the track was poisoned ahead of the city's Magic Millions race day.

title.children: Suspicious items found near damaged Gold Coast Magic Millions racetrack
